newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - Oct 25.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - Oct 25.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Taipei prosecutors find one senior police official involved in a video game scandal, granting the official bail after questioning.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - President Lee Teng-hui urges Taiwanese people to conduct spiritual reform on the date marking the 51st anniversary of Taiwan's emergence from Japanese control.
Cabinet approves proposal to spend more than T$600 billion (US$22 billion) in the next nine years to reconstruct residences for military servicemen and their families.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - China Airlines' planned release of 16 percent of its shares overseas will be aimed at foreign airline companies.
Foreign-flagged but China-owned vessels will be allowed to sail to designated Taiwan harbours.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Finance Ministry suggests all government offices to reduce spending by three percent.
Third-quarter balance of payments is initially estimated to record a surplus of US$1.6 billion.
